thread.title: Rafa Benitez rues missed chances after Newcastle were held by QPR | Football News | Sky Sports
thread.title_full: Rafa Benitez rues missed chances after Newcastle were held by QPR | Football News | Sky Sports

author: Simeon Gholam
title: Rafa Benitez rues missed chances after Newcastle were held by QPR | Football News | Sky Sports
text:
Rafa Benitez rues missed chances after Newcastle were held by QPR By Simeon Gholam Last Updated: 01/02/17 11:17pm Rafa Benitez gives his thoughts after Newcastle were held to a 2-2 draw with QPR Rafa Benitez was frustrated at Newcastle's failure to see the game out after Ciaran Clark's 90th-minute own goal gifted QPR a 2-2 draw in the Sky Bet Championship. 
Jonjo Shelvey fired the Toon in front within a minute at St James' Park, and Matt Ritchie then put them back in the lead after Conor Washington had levelled for the Hoops. 
Newcastle then missed several glorious chances to secure the result, but failed to do so before Clark headed past his own goalkeeper. Upgrade now and watch Chelsea v Arsenal this weekend and get 8 Sky Sports channels! 
"It was a pity, we started really well," Benitez told Sky Sports . "We lost control in the first half for maybe 20 minutes, but then started really well in the second half. 
"We were in control and had three or four opportunities one on one with the goalkeeper that we could have scored from and finished the game, but we didn't do it. Then the own goal is the worst thing that can happen. 
"If you have chances you have to take them. When you have a game won and you draw this way you have to be disappointed. 
"You expect to win at home, but it's a long season and we have to carry on." 
Benitez also signalled his frustration at a failure to add to his squad during the January transfer window, indicating he was hoping to strengthen but wasn't given the backing by the club to do so. 
"My decision was very clear, [but] it was not my decision," he said. "I said what I wanted and needed, and what the team needed, and that was it."
